events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred at the intersection with moderate damage to the vehicle's front end.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the reported collision and vehicle damage details.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to the case to assist the customer with next steps and required documentation.
The customer was sent an acknowledgment email confirming receipt of the auto accident claim today.
The insurer requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and driver’s license to proceed with claim investigation.
Customer uploaded photos of the vehicle damage, the official police report, and their driver's license through the online portal.
Investigation team initiated an inquiry to verify the accident circumstances and evaluate the vehicle's repair needs.
Investigation concluded the claim is valid and assessed damages are consistent with the reported collision incident.
Insurer proposed a settlement amount covering the vehicle repair costs minus the deductible as outlined in the policy.
Customer responded expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciation for quick handling of the claim.
Claim approved by the claims manager after customer acceptance of the proposed settlement amount and terms.
Payment for the settlement amount was issued to the customer’s bank account as per the approved claim.
The claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation that the customer was fully satisfied.
All claim documents and communication were archived securely in the insurance records for future reference.
